titleEnglish: A Day at an Amusement Park
croatian: Jučer sam bio u zabavnom parku. Došao sam s prijateljima ujutro. Kupili smo karte na ulazu. Vozili smo se na velikom vrtuljku i svi smo se smijali. Poslije smo išli na vlak smrti i bilo je malo strašno, ali i zabavno. Jeli smo sladoled i pili sok. Hodali smo kroz park i gledali mnogo šarenih igara. Na kraju dana bili smo umorni, ali sretni. Bilo je lijepo provesti cijeli dan u zabavnom parku.
english: Yesterday I was at an amusement park. I came with friends in the morning. We bought tickets at the entrance. We rode on the big carousel and everyone laughed. Later we went on the roller coaster and it was a little scary, but also fun. We ate ice cream and drank juice. We walked through the park and saw many colorful games. At the end of the day we were tired but happy. It was nice to spend the whole day at the amusement park.

croatian: Jučer sam proveo cijelo prijepodne u knjižnici. Došao sam rano jer sam htio naći mirno mjesto za učenje. Knjižnica je velika i tiha, s mnogo stolova i polica punih knjiga. Prvo sam posudio jednu knjigu o povijesti i jednu knjigu na engleskom jeziku. Zatim sam sjeo za stol i čitao nekoliko sati. Oko mene su studenti učili i pisali zadaće. Ponekad je netko došao pitati knjižničarku za pomoć, ali većinom je bilo vrlo mirno. U pauzi sam otišao do kafića u blizini, popio kavu i vratio se. Na kraju dana vratio sam knjige na policu i otišao kući zadovoljan jer sam puno naučio.
english: Yesterday I spent the whole morning in the library. I came early because I wanted to find a quiet place to study. The library is big and quiet, with many tables and shelves full of books. First I borrowed a book about history and a book in English. Then I sat at a table and read for several hours. Around me, students were studying and writing homework. Sometimes someone came to ask the librarian for help, but most of the time it was very quiet. During the break I went to a café nearby, drank coffee, and returned. At the end of the day I put the books back on the shelf and went home satisfied because I had learned a lot.

croatian: Prošli vikend bio sam u zoološkom vrtu. Došao sam s obitelji ujutro. Vidjeli smo lava kako leži na suncu. Majmuni su skakali i igrali se. Djeca su se smijala jer je majmun bio smiješan. Vidjeli smo i žirafe s dugim vratovima i slona koji je jeo travu. Kupili smo sendviče i sok u malom kafiću. Hodali smo kroz vrt i gledali ptice i ribe. Na kraju dana svi smo bili umorni, ali sretni. Bio je to lijep dan u zoološkom vrtu.
english: Last weekend I was at the zoo. I came with my family in the morning. We saw a lion lying in the sun. The monkeys were jumping and playing. The children laughed because the monkey was funny. We also saw giraffes with long necks and an elephant eating grass. We bought sandwiches and juice in a small café. We walked through the zoo and saw birds and fish. At the end of the day we were all tired but happy. It was a nice day at the zoo.

croatian: U nedjelju sam bio na selu. Došao sam kod bake i djeda ujutro. Kuća je mala, ali lijepa. U dvorištu je bila kokoš i pas. Hodao sam po polju i vidio sam krave i ovce. Sunce je sjalo i bilo je mirno. Baka je kuhala ručak, a djed je radio u vrtu. Jeli smo juhu i kruh, a poslije smo pili kavu. Popodne sam sjedio pod drvetom i čitao knjigu. Na kraju dana vratio sam se kući umoran, ali sretan.
english: On Sunday I was in the countryside. I went to my grandparents in the morning. The house is small but nice. In the yard there was a chicken and a dog. I walked through the field and saw cows and sheep. The sun was shining and it was peaceful. Grandma cooked lunch and grandpa worked in the garden. We ate soup and bread, and later we drank coffee. In the afternoon I sat under a tree and read a book. At the end of the day I returned home tired but happy.

titleEnglish: A Song of Ice and Fire

croatian: Albert Einstein rođen je četrnaestog ožujka tisuću osamsto sedamdeset devete godine u gradu Ulmu u Njemačkoj. Kad je bio dijete, volio je postavljati pitanja i razmišljati o svemiru, svjetlu i vremenu. Studirao je fiziku u Švicarskoj i kasnije radio kao učitelj i znanstvenik. Godine tisuću devetsto pete objavio je nekoliko važnih radova, uključujući teoriju relativnosti, koja je promijenila način na koji ljudi razumiju prostor i vrijeme. Einstein je kasnije dobio Nobelovu nagradu za fiziku zbog objašnjenja fotoelektričnog efekta. Tijekom Drugog svjetskog rata preselio se u Sjedinjene Američke Države, gdje je radio na Sveučilištu Princeton. Bio je poznat ne samo po svom znanju nego i po svom mirnom i skromnom karakteru. Umro je tisuću devetsto pedeset pete godine, ali njegove ideje i dalje imaju veliki utjecaj na znanost i svijet.
english: Albert Einstein was born on March 14, 1879, in the city of Ulm, Germany. As a child, he loved to ask questions and think about space, light, and time. He studied physics in Switzerland and later worked as a teacher and scientist. In 1955, he published several important papers, including the theory of relativity, which changed the way people understand space and time. Einstein later won the Nobel Prize in Physics for his explanation of the photoelectric effect. During World War II, he moved to the United States, where he worked at Princeton University. He was known not only for his knowledge but also for his calm and modest character. He died in 1955, but his ideas continue to have a great influence on science and the world.

croatian: Umjetna inteligencija je grana znanosti koja pokušava stvoriti računala koja mogu misliti i učiti kao ljudi. Danas se koristi u mnogim područjima, kao što su medicina, promet i obrazovanje. Na primjer, u bolnicama umjetna inteligencija pomaže liječnicima da brže pronađu bolest, a u prometu pomaže u vožnji automobila bez vozača. Ljudi koriste i pametne asistente na mobitelima koji razumiju glas i odgovaraju na pitanja. Iako mnogi vide umjetnu inteligenciju kao korisnu, neki se boje da bi mogla zamijeniti ljudski rad. Zato je važno da ljudi uče kako koristiti tehnologiju na pametan i siguran način, tako da nam može pomoći, a ne naštetiti.
english: Artificial intelligence is a branch of science that attempts to create computers that can think and learn like humans. Today, it is used in many areas, such as medicine, traffic, and education. For example, in hospitals, artificial intelligence helps doctors diagnose illnesses more quickly, and in traffic, it helps driverless cars drive. People also use smart assistants on their phones that understand their voices and answer questions. While many see artificial intelligence as useful, some fear that it could replace human work. That's why it's important for people to learn how to use technology in a smart and safe way, so that it can help us, not harm us.

croatian:
Na toplom ljetnom suncu Marko je hodao uskom ulicom u Zagrebu. Bio je prvi put u gradu i tražio je glavni trg, ali nije znao kojim putem treba ići. Kad je ugledao starijeg gospodina s kapom, odlučio je prići.
„Oprostite,“ rekao je Marko ljubazno, „gdje je glavni trg?“
Gospodin se nasmiješio i pokazao rukom prema velikoj zgradi na kraju ulice. „Samo ravno, pa lijevo kod pekare. Tamo je trg.“
„Hvala vam puno,“ odgovorio je Marko s olakšanjem.
„Nema na čemu,“ rekao je gospodin. „Uživajte u Zagrebu!“
Marko se zahvalio još jednom i nastavio hodati. Ubrzo je ugledao mnoštvo ljudi, zvukove tramvaja i veliki sat na trgu. Znao je da je stigao.
english:
Under the warm summer sun, Marko walked down a narrow street in Zagreb. It was his first time in the city, and he was looking for the main square but didn’t know which way to go. When he saw an older man wearing a hat, he decided to approach him.
“Excuse me,” Marko said politely, “where is the main square?”
The man smiled and pointed toward a large building at the end of the street. “Just straight ahead, then left by the bakery. The square is there.”
“Thank you very much,” Marko replied with relief.
“You’re welcome,” said the man. “Enjoy Zagreb!”
Marko thanked him again and kept walking. Soon he saw a crowd of people, the sound of trams, and a large clock in the square. He knew he had arrived.

titleEnglish: Asking for Help at the Airport
croatian:
Ana je stajala u velikoj zgradi aerodroma s kartom u ruci. Bila je uzbuđena, ali i pomalo nervozna jer nije mogla pronaći svoj izlaz. Pogledala je oko sebe i ugledala ljubaznog zaposlenika u plavoj uniformi. Prišla mu je polako.
„Oprostite,“ rekla je tiho, „gdje je izlaz broj deset?“
Zaposlenik se nasmiješio i pokazao prema desnoj strani hodnika. „Idite ravno, pa skrenite desno kod kafića. Tamo ćete vidjeti znak za izlaz deset.“
Ana je klimnula glavom. „Hvala vam puno! Moj let polazi uskoro.“
„Nema problema,“ rekao je zaposlenik. „Sretan put!“
Ana se nasmijala, zahvalila još jednom i potrčala prema desnoj strani. Kad je ugledala veliki broj deset iznad vrata, osjetila je veliko olakšanje.
english:
Ana stood in the large airport building with her ticket in hand. She was excited but also a bit nervous because she couldn’t find her gate. She looked around and saw a kind employee in a blue uniform. She slowly walked up to him.
“Excuse me,” she said softly, “where is gate number ten?”
The employee smiled and pointed toward the right side of the hall. “Go straight, then turn right by the café. You’ll see the sign for gate ten there.”
Ana nodded. “Thank you very much! My flight leaves soon.”
“No problem,” said the employee. “Have a nice trip!”
Ana smiled, thanked him again, and ran to the right. When she saw the big number ten above the door, she felt great relief.

croatian:
Petar je sjeo u mali kafić blizu centra grada. Miris svježe kave ispunio je prostor, ali on je mislio samo na jedno — treba mu internet. Izvadio je svoj telefon i pogledao popis mreža. Sve su bile zaključane. Pogledao je prema šanku, gdje je stajala nasmijana konobarica.
„Oprostite,“ rekao je pristojno, „imate li Wi-Fi?“
Konobarica se nasmijala i pokazala na malu pločicu kraj aparata za kavu. „Da, naravno. Mreža se zove CaféSun, a lozinka je dobrakava123.“
„Hvala vam!“ rekao je Petar s olakšanjem. „Treba mi da pošaljem poruku prijatelju.“
„Nema na čemu,“ odgovorila je konobarica. „Ako ne radi, samo mi recite.“
Petar je utipkao lozinku, i nakon nekoliko sekundi, na ekranu se pojavila mala ikona Wi-Fi signala. Zadovoljno se naslonio i počeo tipkati poruku.
english:
Petar sat down in a small café near the city center. The smell of fresh coffee filled the air, but he had only one thing on his mind — he needed internet. He took out his phone and checked the list of networks. All were locked. He looked toward the counter, where a smiling waitress was standing.
“Excuse me,” he said politely, “do you have Wi-Fi?”
The waitress smiled and pointed to a small sign near the coffee machine. “Yes, of course. The network is called CaféSun, and the password is dobrakava123.”
“Thank you!” said Petar with relief. “I need it to send a message to a friend.”
“You’re welcome,” replied the waitress. “If it doesn’t work, just tell me.”
Petar typed in the password, and after a few seconds, a small Wi-Fi icon appeared on the screen. Pleased, he leaned back and started typing his message.

croatian:
Luka je nervozno sjedio u čekaonici i držao ruke na koljenima. Zvuk bušilice čuo se iza zatvorenih vrata, a on je duboko uzdahnuo. Nakon nekoliko minuta, medicinska sestra je otvorila vrata i rekla: „Gospodine Luka, izvolite unutra.“
Ušao je u svijetlu sobu gdje ga je dočekala zubarica s bijelom maskom i toplim osmijehom.
„Dobar dan,“ rekla je. „Što vas boli?“
„Zub,“ odgovorio je Luka tiho. „Desni gore, boli kad jedem.“
Zubarica je kimnula i rekla: „Dobro, otvorite usta. Pogledat ćemo.“
Nakon kratkog pregleda, nasmiješila se. „Ništa ozbiljno, samo mali karijes. Popravit ćemo brzo.“
Luka je zatvorio oči dok je čuo lagani zvuk aparata. Kad je sve završilo, zubarica mu je rekla: „Gotovo je. Pokušajte ne jesti ništa tvrdo danas.“
Luka je zahvalno ustao i rekao: „Hvala vam puno!“
„Nema na čemu,“ odgovorila je ona. „Vidimo se na kontroli!“
english:
Luka sat nervously in the waiting room, his hands resting on his knees. The sound of a drill came from behind a closed door, and he took a deep breath. After a few minutes, the nurse opened the door and said, “Mr. Luka, please come in.”
He walked into a bright room where the dentist, wearing a white mask and a warm smile, greeted him.
“Good day,” she said. “What hurts?”
“My tooth,” Luka answered quietly. “The upper right one, it hurts when I eat.”
The dentist nodded. “Alright, open your mouth. Let’s take a look.”
After a short examination, she smiled. “Nothing serious, just a small cavity. We’ll fix it quickly.”
Luka closed his eyes as he heard the gentle sound of the machine. When it was all done, the dentist said, “It’s finished. Try not to eat anything hard today.”
Luka stood up gratefully and said, “Thank you very much!”
“You’re welcome,” she replied. “See you for your check-up!”

croatian: Danas pečem kekse u kuhinji. Uzimam brašno, šećer, jaje i malo maslaca. Miješam sve u velikoj zdjeli. Tijesto je mekano i lijepo miriše. Pravim male kuglice i stavljam ih na pladanj. Pečem kekse u pećnici dvadeset minuta. Dok čekam, pijem čaj i gledam kroz prozor. Kada su keksi gotovi, oni su topli i slatki. Dajem kekse prijateljima i svi smo sretni.
english: Today I am baking cookies in the kitchen. I take flour, sugar, an egg, and some butter. I mix everything in a big bowl. The dough is soft and smells nice. I make small balls and put them on a tray. I bake the cookies in the oven for twenty minutes. While I wait, I drink tea and look out the window. When the cookies are done, they are warm and sweet. I give the cookies to friends and we are all happy.

croatian: Plavi kit je najveća životinja na svijetu. Živi u oceanima i morima širom planeta. Može biti dug više od dvadeset i pet metara i težak kao mnogo automobila zajedno. Plavi kit jede vrlo malu hranu koja se zove kril. Svaki dan može pojesti velike količine krila. Iako je ogroman, plavi kit je mirna i spora životinja. Plavi kit diše zrak i mora izaći na površinu da udahne. Kada izdiše, izbacuje vodu visoko u zrak. Njegov glas je vrlo glasan i može se čuti na velikoj udaljenosti. Danas je plavi kit zaštićena vrsta. Ljudi ga više ne love, ali mora se čuvati more kako bi mogao sigurno živjeti.
english: The blue whale is the largest animal in the world. It lives in oceans and seas all over the planet. It can be more than twenty-five meters long and weigh as much as many cars combined. The blue whale eats a very small food called krill. It can eat large quantities of krill every day. Although it is huge, the blue whale is a calm and slow animal. The blue whale breathes air and must come to the surface to breathe. When it exhales, it expels water high into the air. Its call is very loud and can be heard from a great distance. Today, the blue whale is a protected species. People no longer hunt it, but the sea must be protected so that it can live safely.

croatian:
Marija je stigla u mali hotel blizu mora. Nosila je ruksak i osjećala se umorno nakon dugog puta. Ušla je u predvorje gdje je za pultom stajao ljubazan recepcioner s osmijehom.
„Dobar dan,“ rekla je Marija. „Imate li slobodnu sobu za jednu noć?“
Recepcioner je pogledao u računalo i kimnuo. „Da, imamo. Želite li jednokrevetnu ili dvokrevetnu sobu?“
„Jednokrevetnu, molim,“ odgovorila je Marija. „Koliko košta?“
„Osamdeset eura po noći, s doručkom,“ rekao je on.
„U redu,“ rekla je zadovoljno. „Mogu platiti karticom?“
„Naravno,“ odgovorio je recepcioner i pružio joj formular. „Molim vas, ispunite svoje ime i prezime.“
Marija je potpisala i uzela ključ s brojem sedam. „Hvala vam,“ rekla je s osmijehom.
„Nema na čemu,“ rekao je recepcioner. „Soba je na prvom katu, lift je desno.“
Marija se zahvalila još jednom i ušla u lift, sretna što će se napokon odmoriti.
english:
Marija arrived at a small hotel near the sea. She carried a backpack and felt tired after a long journey. She entered the lobby, where a friendly receptionist stood behind the counter with a smile.
“Good afternoon,” Marija said. “Do you have a room available for one night?”
The receptionist looked at the computer and nodded. “Yes, we do. Would you like a single or a double room?”
“A single, please,” Marija replied. “How much is it?”
“Eighty euros per night, with breakfast,” he said.
“Alright,” she said happily. “Can I pay by card?”
“Of course,” replied the receptionist, handing her a form. “Please write your name and surname.”
Marija signed and took the key marked with the number seven. “Thank you,” she said with a smile.
“You’re welcome,” said the receptionist. “Your room is on the first floor, the elevator is to the right.”
Marija thanked him again and entered the elevator, happy to finally get some rest.

titleCroatian: Savjeti za putovanje s malim budžetom
croatian: Putovanje ne mora biti skupo ako dobro planirate. Prvo je važno kupiti karte unaprijed jer su tada često jeftinije. Mnogi turisti koriste autobuse ili vlakove umjesto aviona kako bi uštedjeli novac. Smještaj se može pronaći u hostelima ili kod domaćina putem internetskih stranica. Također je pametno jesti u lokalnim restoranima ili kupovati hranu u trgovinama umjesto u skupim mjestima za turiste. Dobar savjet je i ponijeti bocu za vodu i punjač za telefon. Putovanje s malim budžetom zahtijeva malo truda, ali može biti vrlo zabavno i donijeti mnogo novih iskustava.
english: Traveling doesn't have to be expensive if you plan well. First, it's important to buy tickets in advance, as they are often cheaper. Many tourists use buses or trains instead of planes to save money. Accommodation can be found in hostels or with homestays through websites. It's also a good idea to eat at local restaurants or buy food in stores instead of in expensive tourist spots. It's also a good idea to bring a bottle of water and a phone charger. Traveling on a budget requires a little effort, but it can be a lot of fun and bring a lot of new experiences.

croatian: Kapsulski hoteli su mali i moderni hoteli. Najčešće se nalaze u Japanu, ali danas postoje i u drugim zemljama. U njima gosti spavaju u malim kapsulama umjesto u velikim sobama. Svaka kapsula ima krevet, svjetlo i ponekad mali televizor. Kapsule su čiste i praktične, ali nemaju puno prostora. Kupaonice i tuševi su zajednički. Kapsulski hoteli su jeftiniji od običnih hotela. Dobri su za kratki boravak ili za ljude koji putuju sami. Mnogi ih biraju jer su jednostavni i zanimljivi.
english: Capsule hotels are small and modern hotels. They are most often found in Japan, but they also exist in other countries today. In them, guests sleep in small capsules instead of large rooms. Each capsule has a bed, light and sometimes a small television. The capsules are clean and practical, but they don't have much space. Bathrooms and showers are shared. Capsule hotels are cheaper than regular hotels. They are good for short stays or for people traveling alone. Many choose them because they are simple and interesting.

croatian:
Ivan je stigao u hotel kasno poslijepodne, s koferom u ruci i laganim osmijehom na licu. Bio je umoran od putovanja i jedva je čekao da se istušira i odmori. Ušao je u prostrano predvorje i prišao pultu. Iza njega je stajala recepcionerka s urednom kosom i toplim glasom.
„Dobar dan,“ rekao je Ivan. „Imam rezervaciju na ime Ivan Kovač.“
Recepcionerka je pogledala u računalo i nasmiješila se. „Da, gospodine Kovač, sve je u redu. Jednokrevetna soba na drugom katu, zar ne?“
„Tako je,“ potvrdio je on.
„Molim vas, osobnu iskaznicu,“ rekla je i pružila mu ruku. Ivan joj je dao dokument, a ona je brzo upisala podatke. „Ovdje je vaš ključ,“ rekla je i pokazala na lift. „Doručak je od sedam do deset sati, a Wi-Fi lozinka je na kartici u sobi.“
„Odlično, hvala vam puno,“ rekao je Ivan.
„Nema na čemu,“ odgovorila je recepcionerka s osmijehom. „Ugodan boravak!“
Ivan je uzeo ključ i krenuo prema liftu. Dok su se vrata zatvarala, osjetio je olakšanje — konačno je stigao.
english:
Ivan arrived at the hotel in the late afternoon, suitcase in hand and a faint smile on his face. He was tired from traveling and couldn’t wait to shower and rest. He entered the spacious lobby and approached the counter. Behind it stood a receptionist with neat hair and a warm voice.
“Good afternoon,” Ivan said. “I have a reservation under the name Ivan Kovač.”
The receptionist looked at the computer and smiled. “Yes, Mr. Kovač, everything is in order. A single room on the second floor, correct?”
“That’s right,” he confirmed.
“Your ID, please,” she said, reaching out her hand. Ivan handed over the document, and she quickly entered the details. “Here’s your key,” she said, pointing toward the elevator. “Breakfast is from seven to ten, and the Wi-Fi password is on the card in your room.”
“Great, thank you very much,” said Ivan.
“You’re welcome,” replied the receptionist with a smile. “Enjoy your stay!”
Ivan took the key and walked toward the elevator. As the doors closed, he felt a wave of relief — he had finally arrived.

croatian: Gradski parkovi su zelena mjesta u gradu. Ljudi tamo dolaze da se odmore, šetaju ili sjede na klupi. Parkovi su važni jer u gradu nema puno prirode. U parku se mogu vidjeti drveće, cvijeće i trava. Djeca se igraju, a odrasli često čitaju ili razgovaraju. Neki ljudi trče ili voze bicikl. Gradski parkovi su dobri za zdravlje i raspoloženje. Oni čine grad ljepšim i mirnijim mjestom za život.
english: City parks are green spaces in the city. People come there to rest, walk or sit on a bench. Parks are important because there is not much nature in the city. In the park you can see trees, flowers and grass. Children play, and adults often read or talk. Some people run or ride a bike. City parks are good for your health and mood. They make the city a more beautiful and peaceful place to live.

croatian: Danas čistim svoju sobu. Prvo otvaram prozor da uđe svjež zrak. Zatim uzimam metlu i čistim pod. Stavljam odjeću u ormar i bacam smeće u koš. Brišem stol i stavljam knjige na policu. Poslije namještam krevet i mijenjam posteljinu. Moja soba sada izgleda lijepo i uredno. Osjećam se dobro kada je soba čista.
english: Today I am cleaning my room. First I open the window to let in fresh air. Then I take a broom and clean the floor. I put clothes in the closet and throw the trash in the bin. I wipe the table and put books on the shelf. Afterwards I make the bed and change the sheets. My room now looks nice and tidy. I feel good when the room is clean.

croatian: Klimatske promjene znače dugoročne promjene vremena na Zemlji. Posljednjih godina temperature rastu, a vremenski uvjeti postaju sve ekstremniji. Sve češće vidimo toplinske valove, jake kiše i suše. Jedan od glavnih uzroka klimatskih promjena je ljudska aktivnost. Industrija, promet i korištenje fosilnih goriva stvaraju plinove koji zadržavaju toplinu u atmosferi. Zbog toga se planeta zagrijava. Klimatske promjene utječu na prirodu, životinje i ljude. Razina mora raste, a neki gradovi i otoci su u opasnosti. Važno je smanjiti zagađenje, štedjeti energiju i brinuti se o okolišu kako bismo zaštitili budućnost.
english: Climate change means long-term changes in the weather on Earth. In recent years, temperatures have been rising and weather conditions are becoming more extreme. We are seeing heat waves, heavy rains and droughts more and more often. One of the main causes of climate change is human activity. Industry, traffic and the use of fossil fuels create gases that trap heat in the atmosphere. This is why the planet is warming. Climate change affects nature, animals and people. Sea levels are rising, and some cities and islands are at risk. It is important to reduce pollution, save energy and take care of the environment in order to protect the future.

croatian: Utješna hrana je hrana koja nas čini sretnima i opuštenima. Ljudi je često jedu kada su umorni, tužni ili pod stresom. Ta hrana nas podsjeća na dom i lijepe trenutke. Za neke ljude to je juha, pire krumpir ili tjestenina. Za druge je to kolač, čokolada ili toplo pecivo. Utješna hrana je obično jednostavna i poznata. Iako nije uvijek najzdravija, utješna hrana može poboljšati raspoloženje. Najvažnije je jesti je umjereno i uživati u njoj.
english: Comfort food is food that makes us happy and relaxed. People often eat it when they are tired, sad, or stressed. These foods remind us of home and good times. For some people, it’s soup, mashed potatoes, or pasta. For others, it’s cake, chocolate, or a warm pastry. Comfort foods are usually simple and familiar. While they’re not always the healthiest, comfort foods can improve your mood. The most important thing is to eat them in moderation and enjoy them.

croatian: Kompas je jednostavan, ali vrlo važan instrument koji pokazuje smjer. U sredini kompasa nalazi se mala magnetska igla koja uvijek pokazuje prema sjeveru. Ljudi su kompas koristili tisućama godina, posebno mornari i putnici. Prije nego što su postojale karte i GPS, kompas je bio glavni alat za pronalaženje puta. Danas se kompasi koriste i u školama, planinarenju i vojsci. Postoje digitalni kompasi na mobitelima, ali mnogi još uvijek vole imati pravi kompas jer ne treba baterije. Kompas nas podsjeća koliko je važno znati gdje smo i kojim putem želimo ići.
english: A compass is a simple but very important instrument that shows direction. In the center of a compass is a small magnetic needle that always points north. People have used compasses for thousands of years, especially sailors and travelers. Before maps and GPS existed, the compass was the main tool for finding your way. Today, compasses are also used in schools, hiking, and the military. There are digital compasses on mobile phones, but many people still prefer to have a real compass because it doesn't require batteries. A compass reminds us of how important it is to know where we are and which way we want to go.

croatian: Sushi na pokretnoj traci je poseban način jedenja sushija. Ovakvi restorani su vrlo popularni u Japanu, ali postoje i u drugim zemljama. Sushi se kreće oko restorana na traci. Gosti sjede za stolom i gledaju tanjure kako prolaze. Kada vide sushi koji im se sviđa, uzmu tanjur. Svaki tanjur ima svoju boju i cijenu. Ovaj način jedenja je zabavan i jednostavan. Ljudi mogu probati različite vrste sushija bez čekanja. Sushi na pokretnoj traci je dobar izbor za brzi i opušten obrok.
english: Conveyor belt sushi is a special way of eating sushi. These restaurants are very popular in Japan, but they also exist in other countries. The sushi moves around the restaurant on a conveyor belt. Guests sit at a table and watch the plates pass by. When they see sushi they like, they take a plate. Each plate has its own color and price. This way of eating is fun and easy. People can try different types of sushi without having to wait. Conveyor belt sushi is a good choice for a quick and casual meal.

croatian: Društvene mreže mogu biti zabavne, ali imaju i opasnosti. Ljudi ponekad provode previše vremena na telefonu i zaborave na školu ili posao. Na mrežama se mogu pojaviti lažne vijesti koje nisu istinite. Djeca i mladi mogu dobiti ružne poruke od drugih ljudi. Također, osobni podaci mogu biti nesigurni. Zato je važno biti pažljiv i koristiti društvene mreže na siguran način.
english: Social media can be fun, but it also has dangers. People sometimes spend too much time on their phones and forget about school or work. On social media false news can appear that is not true. Children and young people can receive mean messages from other people. Also, personal data can be unsafe. That’s why it is important to be careful and use social media in a safe way.

croatian: Oaza je mjesto u pustinji gdje ima vode i biljaka. U oazi rastu palme, trava i ponekad voće. Ljudi u pustinji dolaze u oazu da piju vodu i odmaraju. Životinje također traže oazu jer je tamo hladnije i ima hrane. Oaze su važne za putnike i karavane koji prolaze kroz pustinju. Bez oaza život u pustinji bio bi mnogo teži.
english: An oasis is a place in the desert where there is water and plants. In an oasis palm trees, grass, and sometimes fruit grow. People in the desert come to an oasis to drink water and rest. Animals also look for an oasis because it is cooler there and there is food. Oases are important for travelers and caravans that pass through the desert. Without oases life in the desert would be much harder.

croatian: Dinosauri su velike životinje koje su živjele prije mnogo milijuna godina. Živjeli su na Zemlji prije ljudi. Neki dinosauri su bili biljojedi, a neki mesojedi. Postojale su mnoge vrste dinosaura. Neki su bili mali, a neki vrlo veliki. Najveći dinosauri bili su duži od autobusa. Imali su različite oblike tijela i zube. Danas dinosauri više ne postoje. Znanstvenici proučavaju njihove kosti i fosile kako bi saznali više o njihovom životu. Dinosauri su i dalje vrlo zanimljivi ljudima, posebno djeci.
english: Dinosaurs are large animals that lived many millions of years ago. They lived on Earth before humans. Some dinosaurs were herbivores and some were carnivores. There were many types of dinosaurs. Some were small and some were very large. The largest dinosaurs were longer than buses. They had different body shapes and teeth. Today, dinosaurs are no longer around. Scientists study their bones and fossils to learn more about their lives. Dinosaurs are still very interesting to people, especially children.

croatian:
Sara je sjedila u malom restoranu s prijateljicom Lanom. Konobar im je donio jelovnik, a miris hrane širio se cijelom prostorijom. Sara je pažljivo čitala jela jer je znala da mora biti oprezna. Nakon nekoliko trenutaka, podigla je pogled prema konobaru.
„Oprostite,“ rekla je ljubazno, „imam alergiju na orahe. Ima li ovo jelo orahe?“
Konobar se nagnuo bliže i pogledao jelovnik. „Ne, ovo jelo nema orahe,“ odgovorio je. „Ali desert s čokoladom ih ima.“
Sara je klimnula glavom. „Dobro, hvala. Onda ću uzeti piletinu s povrćem.“
„Naravno,“ rekao je konobar i zapisao narudžbu. „Hvala što ste rekli za alergiju, obavijestit ću kuhinju.“
Lana se nasmijala. „Uvijek si tako oprezna.“
„Moram biti,“ rekla je Sara tiho. „Jednom sam jela kolač s orasima i završila u bolnici.“
Lana je odmah uozbiljila lice. „Onda je dobro da pitaš svaki put.“
Sara se nasmiješila i otpila gutljaj vode. Osjećala se mirno jer je ovaj put sve bilo pod kontrolom.
english:
Sara sat in a small restaurant with her friend Lana. The waiter brought them menus, and the smell of food filled the room. Sara read the dishes carefully because she knew she had to be cautious. After a few moments, she looked up at the waiter.
“Excuse me,” she said politely, “I’m allergic to nuts. Does this dish have any?”
The waiter leaned closer and looked at the menu. “No, this dish doesn’t have nuts,” he replied. “But the chocolate dessert does.”
Sara nodded. “Alright, thank you. Then I’ll have the chicken with vegetables.”
“Of course,” said the waiter, writing down the order. “Thanks for telling me about the allergy — I’ll let the kitchen know.”
Lana smiled. “You’re always so careful.”
“I have to be,” Sara said quietly. “I once ate a cake with nuts and ended up in the hospital.”
Lana’s face grew serious. “Then it’s good that you ask every time.”
Sara smiled and took a sip of water. She felt calm, knowing everything was under control this time.

croatian: Mnogi ljudi misle da životinje imaju osobnost. Psi mogu biti veseli, mirni ili znatiželjni. Mačke ponekad vole igru, a ponekad žele biti same. Neki konji su hrabri, a neki se lako uplaše. Papige mogu biti glasne i vole pažnju. Kao i ljudi, životinje pokazuju različita ponašanja. Zato mnogi vlasnici kažu da njihove životinje imaju posebnu osobnost.
english: Many people think that animals have personality. Dogs can be cheerful, calm, or curious. Cats sometimes like to play, and sometimes they want to be alone. Some horses are brave, and some are easily frightened. Parrots can be loud and like attention. Like people, animals show different behaviors. That’s why many owners say that their animals have a special personality.

croatian: Potres je jako kretanje tla. On se događa kada se zemlja iznenada pomakne. Ponekad potres traje samo nekoliko sekundi, ali može biti vrlo snažan. U potresu se kuće i ceste mogu srušiti. Ljudi trebaju tražiti sigurno mjesto, na primjer ispod stola ili uza zid. U mnogim zemljama postoje pravila kako se zaštititi u potresu. Potresi pokazuju koliko je priroda jaka.
english: An earthquake is a strong movement of the ground. It happens when the earth suddenly shifts. Sometimes an earthquake lasts only a few seconds, but it can be very strong. In an earthquake houses and roads can collapse. People need to find a safe place, for example under a table or by a wall. In many countries there are rules on how to protect yourself in an earthquake. Earthquakes show how strong nature is.

titleEnglish: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

croatian: Kutija prve pomoći je važna u svakoj kući, školi i autu. U njoj se nalaze zavoji, flasteri, škare i rukavice. Tu su i tablete protiv boli, termometar i dezinfekcijsko sredstvo. Ljudi koriste kutiju prve pomoći kada se netko poreže ili ozlijedi. U bolnicama i na radnim mjestima također uvijek postoji kutija prve pomoći. Ona pomaže da mala rana ili bolest brzo dobije prvu njegu.
english: A first aid kit is important in every home, school, and car. In it there are bandages, plasters, scissors, and gloves. There are also pain tablets, a thermometer, and disinfectant. People use a first aid kit when someone gets cut or injured. In hospitals and at workplaces there is always a first aid kit. It helps a small wound or illness quickly get first care.

croatian: Leteći automobili su vozila koja mogu voziti po cesti i letjeti na nebu. Danas ih još nema puno, ali ljudi ih zamišljaju u budućnosti. Oni bi mogli pomoći da nema velikih gužvi u gradu. Leteći automobil izgleda kao mješavina auta i malog aviona. Ljudi misle da će putovanje biti brže i lakše. Još se mora napraviti mnogo testova da bi leteći automobili bili sigurni.
english: Flying cars are vehicles that can drive on the road and fly in the sky. Today there are not many yet, but people imagine them in the future. They could help so there are no big traffic jams in the city. A flying car looks like a mix of a car and a small airplane. People think travel will be faster and easier. Many more tests must be done before flying cars are safe.

croatian:
Marko je ušao u mali frizerski salon na uglu ulice. U zraku se osjećao miris šampona i svježe kave. Iza pulta je stajala frizerka s osmijehom na licu i makazama u ruci.
„Dobar dan,“ rekla je veselo. „Imate li termin?“
„Nemam,“ odgovorio je Marko, „ali nadam se da me možete primiti.“
Frizerka je pogledala stolac kod prozora. „Naravno, sjednite. Kako želite šišanje?“
Marko je sjeo i pogledao se u ogledalo. „Samo kratko sa strane, ali malo duže gore, molim.“
„U redu,“ rekla je frizerka i počela šišati pažljivo. Zvuk makaza bio je tih i ritmičan.
„Putujete negdje?“ pitala je s osmijehom.
„Da, idem na more,“ odgovorio je Marko. „Htio sam izgledati uredno.“
Kad je završila, frizerka je obrisala vrat ručnikom i pokazala mu ogledalo. „Što mislite?“
Marko se nasmiješio. „Odlično izgleda! Hvala vam puno.“
„Nema na čemu,“ rekla je ona. „Lijep odmor!“
Marko je platio, pozdravio se i izašao na ulicu, osjećajući se svježe i zadovoljno.
english:
Marko walked into a small hair salon on the corner of the street. The air smelled of shampoo and fresh coffee. Behind the counter stood a hairdresser with a smile on her face and scissors in her hand.
“Good afternoon,” she said cheerfully. “Do you have an appointment?”
“I don’t,” replied Marko, “but I hope you can take me.”
The hairdresser looked at the chair by the window. “Of course, please sit down. How would you like your haircut?”
Marko sat and looked at himself in the mirror. “Just short on the sides, but a bit longer on top, please.”
“Alright,” said the hairdresser and began cutting carefully. The sound of the scissors was quiet and rhythmic.
“Are you traveling somewhere?” she asked with a smile.
“Yes, I’m going to the seaside,” Marko answered. “I wanted to look neat.”
When she finished, the hairdresser wiped his neck with a towel and showed him the mirror. “What do you think?”
Marko smiled. “It looks great! Thank you very much.”
“You’re welcome,” she said. “Have a nice holiday!”
Marko paid, said goodbye, and stepped out into the street, feeling fresh and content.

croatian: GPS je sustav koji nam pomaže da pronađemo mjesto. Koristi se u mobitelima, automobilima i satovima. GPS pokazuje gdje se nalazimo i kako doći do cilja. GPS radi pomoću satelita u svemiru. Sateliti šalju signal, a uređaj prima taj signal. Tako možemo vidjeti kartu i rutu na ekranu. Ljudi koriste GPS kada putuju, voze ili hodaju u nepoznatom gradu. GPS je vrlo koristan jer štedi vrijeme i pomaže nam da se ne izgubimo.
english: GPS is a system that helps us find a place. It is used in cell phones, cars and watches. GPS shows where we are and how to get to our destination. GPS works using satellites in space. The satellites send a signal, and the device receives that signal. This way we can see a map and route on the screen. People use GPS when they are traveling, driving or walking in an unfamiliar city. GPS is very useful because it saves time and helps us not to get lost.

croatian: Zdrava prehrana je važna za dobro zdravlje. Ljudi trebaju jesti voće i povrće svaki dan. Važno je piti puno vode i manje gaziranih pića. Meso, riba, jaja i grah daju tijelu proteine. Kruh, riža i tjestenina daju energiju. Slatkiše i masnu hranu treba jesti samo malo. Kada jedemo zdravo, imamo više snage i osjećamo se bolje.
english: Healthy eating is important for good health. People should eat fruit and vegetables every day. It is important to drink a lot of water and less fizzy drinks. Meat, fish, eggs, and beans give the body protein. Bread, rice, and pasta give energy. Sweets and fatty food should be eaten only a little. When we eat healthy, we have more strength and feel better.

croatian: Zimski san je način odmora kod nekih životinja. Tijekom zime je hladno i nema puno hrane. Zato neke životinje spavaju dugo vrijeme. Medvjedi, ježevi i neke druge životinje imaju zimski san. Tijekom tog vremena jedu vrlo malo ili uopće ne jedu. Njihovo tijelo radi sporije i štedi energiju. Kada dođe proljeće, životinje se bude i ponovno traže hranu. Zimski san im pomaže da prežive hladne mjesece.
english: Hibernation is a way for some animals to rest. During the winter it is cold and there is not much food. That is why some animals sleep for a long time. Bears, hedgehogs and some other animals hibernate. During this time they eat very little or not at all. Their bodies work more slowly and save energy. When spring comes, the animals wake up and look for food again. Hibernation helps them survive the cold months.

croatian: Zvijezde nastaju u svemiru iz velikih oblaka plina i prašine. Ti oblaci se zovu maglice. U njima se plin polako skuplja na jedno mjesto. Kada se skupi dovoljno plina, on postaje vrlo vruć. Tada počinje sjajiti i rađa se nova zvijezda. Taj proces traje jako dugo, milijune godina. Zvijezde daju svjetlo i toplinu. Naša Zemlja dobiva svjetlo od Sunca, koje je također zvijezda. Zvijezde su važne za život u svemiru.
english: Stars are formed in the universe from large clouds of gas and dust. These clouds are called nebulae. In them, the gas slowly collects in one place. When enough gas collects, it becomes very hot. Then it starts to shine and a new star is born. This process takes a very long time, millions of years. Stars give off light and heat. Our Earth gets light from the Sun, which is also a star. Stars are important for life in the universe.

croatian: Instant rezanci su brza i jednostavna hrana. Ljudi ih često jedu kada nemaju puno vremena za kuhanje. Mogu se kupiti u mnogim trgovinama. Priprema je vrlo laka. Rezanci se stave u vruću vodu i čekaju nekoliko minuta. U pakiranju je i začin koji daje okus juhi. Instant rezanci nisu uvijek zdravi, ali su jeftini i zasitni. Mnogi ih vole jer su topli, slani i brzo gotovi.
english: Instant noodles are a quick and easy food. People often eat them when they don't have much time to cook. They can be bought in many stores. They are very easy to prepare. The noodles are put in hot water and wait a few minutes. The package also contains a seasoning that gives flavor to the soup. Instant noodles are not always healthy, but they are cheap and filling. Many people like them because they are warm, salty and ready quickly.

croatian: Međugalaktička komunikacija znači slanje poruka između različitih galaksija. Znanstvenici o tome još uvijek puno uče. Galaksije su vrlo daleko jedna od druge. Ljudi koriste radio signale i teleskope da slušaju svemir. Ponekad šalju poruke u svemir u nadi da će ih netko čuti. Te poruke su vrlo jednostavne. Za sada nemamo odgovor od drugih bića. Ipak, istraživanje svemira pomaže nam da bolje razumijemo svijet oko sebe i naše mjesto u njemu.
english: Intergalactic communication means sending messages between different galaxies. Scientists are still learning a lot about it. Galaxies are very far apart. People use radio signals and telescopes to listen to the universe. Sometimes they send messages into space in the hope that someone will hear them. These messages are very simple. So far, we have no answer from other beings. However, space exploration helps us to better understand the world around us and our place in it.

croatian: Doručak je prvi obrok u danu. Mnogi liječnici kažu da je doručak vrlo važan. Kada jedemo doručak, imamo više energije za školu ili posao. Zdrav doručak može biti kruh, sir, jaje ili voće. Ako ne jedemo doručak, možemo biti umorni i bez snage. Zato je dobro započeti dan s doručkom.
english: Breakfast is the first meal of the day. Many doctors say that breakfast is very important. When we eat breakfast, we have more energy for school or work. A healthy breakfast can be bread, cheese, an egg, or fruit. If we don’t eat breakfast, we can be tired and without strength. That’s why it is good to start the day with breakfast.

croatian: Kornati su otoci u Jadranskom moru. Ima ih mnogo, veliki i mali. More oko njih je čisto i plavo. Ljudi tamo plove brodom i kupaju se. Na nekim otocima nema kuća. Priroda je mirna i lijepa. Kornati su poznati park prirode u Hrvatskoj.
english: Kornati are islands in the Adriatic Sea. There are many of them, big and small. The sea around them is clear and blue. People go there by boat and swim. There are no houses on some of the islands. The nature is peaceful and beautiful. Kornati is a famous nature park in Croatia.

croatian: Učenje novog jezika za mene je uvijek izazov, ali i velika prilika. Kada počnem učiti, osjećam se kao da otvaram vrata u novi svijet. Na početku je teško jer ne razumijem mnogo riječi i često se sramim govoriti. Ipak, svaki dan učim malo više i osjećam napredak. Pomaže mi kada gledam filmove s titlovima ili slušam glazbu na tom jeziku. Također pokušavam razgovarati s ljudima, iako pravim pogreške. Mislim da su pogreške važan dio procesa, jer kroz njih najbolje učimo. Ponekad izgubim motivaciju, ali onda se sjetim zašto sam počeo: želim putovati, bolje razumjeti kulturu i možda jednoga dana raditi u drugoj zemlji. Učenje jezika traži vrijeme i strpljenje, ali nagrada je osjećaj da se povezujem s ljudima na nov način.
english: Learning a new language is always a challenge for me, but also a big opportunity. When I start learning, I feel like I am opening the door to a new world. At the beginning it is hard because I don’t understand many words and I am often shy to speak. Still, every day I learn a bit more and feel progress. It helps me when I watch movies with subtitles or listen to music in that language. I also try to talk with people, even though I make mistakes. I think mistakes are an important part of the process, because through them we learn best. Sometimes I lose motivation, but then I remember why I started: I want to travel, understand the culture better, and maybe one day work in another country. Learning a language takes time and patience, but the reward is the feeling that I connect with people in a new way.

croatian: Svaki dan učim nove riječi. Ponekad čitam knjigu ili časopis i pišem nepoznate riječi u bilježnicu. Kod kuće otvorim rječnik i tražim značenje. Ponovim riječi naglas i pokušam napraviti jednostavnu rečenicu. Ponekad slušam pjesme ili gledam filmove i učim nove riječi iz konteksta. Volim kada zapamtim riječ i mogu je koristiti u razgovoru. Polako, ali sigurno, moj rječnik postaje veći.
english: Every day I learn new words. Sometimes I read a book or magazine and write unknown words in a notebook. At home I open a dictionary and look for the meaning. I repeat the words aloud and try to make a simple sentence. Sometimes I listen to songs or watch movies and learn new words from context. I like when I remember a word and can use it in conversation. Slowly but surely, my vocabulary is getting bigger.

croatian: Mars je planeta blizu Zemlje. Na Marsu nema puno zraka i jako je hladno. Ljudi još ne žive tamo, ali znanstvenici šalju robote da istražuju. Oni traže vodu i znakove života. Ako na Marsu ima vode, možda će jednog dana ljudi moći graditi kuće i živjeti tamo. Za sada život na Marsu postoji samo u našim planovima i snovima.
english: Mars is a planet near Earth. On Mars there is not much air and it is very cold. People do not live there yet, but scientists send robots to explore. They are looking for water and signs of life. If there is water on Mars, maybe one day people will be able to build houses and live there. For now, life on Mars exists only in our plans and dreams.

croatian: Magneti su predmeti koji privlače metal. U svakodnevnom životu koristimo magnete na mnoge načine. Na hladnjaku ljudi stavljaju male magnete s papirima ili slikama. U školama magneti pomažu u učenju fizike. U televizorima, računalima i telefonima također postoje mali magneti. Oni pomažu da strojevi dobro rade. Magneti su važni i korisni u našem životu.
english: Magnets are objects that attract metal. In everyday life we use magnets in many ways. On the fridge people put small magnets with papers or pictures. In schools magnets help in learning physics. In televisions, computers, and phones there are also small magnets. They help machines work well. Magnets are important and useful in our lives.

croatian: U velikom gradu ljudi rade pod zemljom. Bogati ljudi žive gore u visokim zgradama. Mladić Freder vidi djevojku Mariju i slijedi je. On vidi radnike koji pate i želi im pomoći. Znanstvenik stvara robota koji izgleda kao Marija. Lažna Marija govori ljudima da se svađaju. Grad postaje opasan. Freder i prava Marija pokušaju spasiti radnike i djecu. Na kraju, Freder povezuje radnike i bogate ljude. Grad opet ima mir.
english: In a big city, people work underground. Rich people live up in tall buildings. A young man named Freder sees a girl named Maria and follows her. He sees the workers suffering and wants to help them. A scientist creates a robot that looks like Maria. The fake Maria tells people to fight. The city becomes dangerous. Freder and the real Maria try to save the workers and children. In the end, Freder connects the workers and the rich people. The city is peaceful again.

croatian: Moj razred je velik i svijetao. U razredu imamo mnogo stolova i stolica. Na zidu je ploča i sat. Učitelj piše na ploči, a mi učenici slušamo. U razredu su i knjige, bilježnice i olovke. Prozor je velik, a kroz prozor vidimo školu i drveće. Ponekad je razred tih, a ponekad bučan. Volim svoj razred jer učim mnogo novih stvari i igram se s prijateljima.
english: My classroom is big and bright. In the classroom we have many tables and chairs. On the wall there is a board and a clock. The teacher writes on the board and we students listen. In the classroom there are also books, notebooks, and pencils. The window is large, and through the window we see the school and the trees. Sometimes the classroom is quiet, and sometimes noisy. I love my classroom because I learn many new things and play with friends.

croatian: Moj omiljeni grad je Zagreb. Volim ići tamo jer ima mnogo lijepih ulica i parkova. U centru grada vidim veliki trg i staru katedralu. Volim piti kavu u kafiću i gledati ljude. Zagreb ima i tramvaje koji voze kroz grad. Ljeti je toplo i ljudi sjede vani. Zimi grad ima snijeg i božićne lampice. Osjećam se sretno kada sam u Zagrebu jer grad ima mnogo života i boja.
english: My favorite city is Zagreb. I like to go there because it has many beautiful streets and parks. In the city center I see a big square and the old cathedral. I like to drink coffee in a café and watch people. Zagreb also has trams that go through the city. In summer it is warm and people sit outside. In winter the city has snow and Christmas lights. I feel happy when I am in Zagreb because the city has a lot of life and color.

croatian: Moja omiljena hrana je pizza. Volim jesti pizzu s rajčicom, sirom i gljivama. Ponekad stavim i šunku ili masline. Pizza je topla i mirisna, i uvijek me veseli. Volim jesti pizzu s prijateljima u restoranu ili kod kuće. Kada jedem pizzu, pijem sok ili vodu. Za mene je pizza najbolja hrana jer je ukusna i jednostavna.
english: My favorite food is pizza. I like to eat pizza with tomato, cheese, and mushrooms. Sometimes I add ham or olives. Pizza is warm and fragrant, and it always makes me happy. I like to eat pizza with friends in a restaurant or at home. When I eat pizza, I drink juice or water. For me, pizza is the best food because it is tasty and simple.

croatian: Moj omiljeni hobi je čitanje knjiga. Volim sjediti u svojoj sobi i čitati priče. Čitam ujutro prije škole ili navečer prije spavanja. Najviše volim čitati kratke priče i jednostavne romane. Ponekad idem u knjižnicu i posudim novu knjigu. Kada čitam, osjećam se mirno i sretno. Knjige mi pokazuju nove ljude i nova mjesta. Zato je čitanje moj omiljeni hobi.
english: My favorite hobby is reading books. I like to sit in my room and read stories. I read in the morning before school or in the evening before sleep. I like best to read short stories and simple novels. Sometimes I go to the library and borrow a new book. When I read, I feel calm and happy. Books show me new people and new places. That is why reading is my favorite hobby.

croatian: Jučer sam prvi put kuhao. Htio sam napraviti juhu. Uzeo sam lonac, vodu, mrkvu i krumpir. Rezao sam povrće polako jer nisam znao dobro rezati. Stavio sam sve u lonac i čekao. Ponekad sam miješao juhu žlicom. Miris je bio dobar, ali juha je bila malo slana. Moja obitelj je jela juhu i rekla da je dobra. Bio sam sretan jer sam prvi put sam kuhao.
english: Yesterday I cooked for the first time. I wanted to make soup. I took a pot, water, a carrot, and a potato. I cut the vegetables slowly because I didn’t know how to cut well. I put everything in the pot and waited. Sometimes I stirred the soup with a spoon. The smell was good, but the soup was a little salty. My family ate the soup and said it was good. I was happy because I cooked alone for the first time.

croatian: Moj dom je mali, ali lijep. U njemu imam dnevnu sobu, kuhinju, kupaonicu i spavaću sobu. U dnevnoj sobi je stol, stolice i televizija. Kuhinja je svijetla i u njoj kuham hranu. U spavaćoj sobi je krevet i ormar. U kupaonici je ogledalo i tuš. Moj dom ima prozore i vrata, a ispred kuće je malo dvorište. Volim svoj dom jer je topao i udoban.
english: My home is small but nice. It has a living room, kitchen, bathroom, and bedroom. In the living room there is a table, chairs, and a television. The kitchen is bright and I cook food in it. In the bedroom there is a bed and a wardrobe. In the bathroom there is a mirror and a shower. My home has windows and doors, and in front of the house there is a small yard. I love my home because it is warm and comfortable.

croatian: Svako jutro idem na posao. Ustajem rano i doručkujem kod kuće. Zatim idem na autobus. Autobus dolazi u sedam sati. U autobusu vidim mnogo ljudi. Neki ljudi čitaju, a neki razgovaraju. Ja obično gledam kroz prozor ili slušam glazbu. Put traje oko trideset minuta. Kada stignem, izlazim iz autobusa i idem pješice do posla. Moje jutarnje putovanje je jednostavno i mirno.
english: Every morning I go to work. I get up early and eat breakfast at home. Then I go to the bus. The bus comes at seven o’clock. On the bus I see many people. Some people read, and some talk. I usually look out the window or listen to music. The trip takes about thirty minutes. When I arrive, I get off the bus and walk to work. My morning commute is simple and calm.

croatian: Svako jutro ustajem u sedam sati. Prvo perem lice i zube. Zatim oblačim odjeću i spremam krevet. Nakon toga pijem kavu i jedem doručak, obično kruh i sir. Ponekad slušam glazbu ili gledam vijesti. Poslije uzimam torbu i idem u školu ili na posao. Moja jutarnja rutina je jednostavna, ali mi pomaže da dobro počnem dan.
english: Every morning I get up at seven o’clock. First I wash my face and brush my teeth. Then I put on clothes and make my bed. After that I drink coffee and eat breakfast, usually bread and cheese. Sometimes I listen to music or watch the news. Afterwards I take my bag and go to school or work. My morning routine is simple, but it helps me start the day well.

croatian: Moj kvart je miran i lijep. U kvartu su kuće, stanovi i trgovine. Blizu moje kuće je škola i mala pekarnica. Ima i park gdje djeca igraju nogomet i ljudi šeću pse. Ulica je duga i ima mnogo stabala. Ponekad idem u trgovinu ili pijem kavu u kafiću na uglu. Moj kvart nije velik, ali je ugodan i svi se ljudi poznaju.
english: My neighborhood is quiet and nice. In the neighborhood there are houses, apartments, and shops. Near my home there is a school and a small bakery. There is also a park where children play football and people walk dogs. The street is long and has many trees. Sometimes I go to the shop or drink coffee in the café on the corner. My neighborhood is not big, but it is pleasant and everyone knows each other.

croatian: Imam dva kućna ljubimca. To su pas i mačka. Moj pas se zove Max. On je velik, ali dobar i voli se igrati u parku. Moja mačka se zove Maja. Ona je mala i voli spavati na kauču. Svako jutro dajem im hranu i vodu. Ponekad češljam mačku i šetam psa. Jako volim svoje ljubimce jer su moji prijatelji i uvijek su sa mnom.
english: I have two pets. They are a dog and a cat. My dog’s name is Max. He is big but good and likes to play in the park. My cat’s name is Maja. She is small and likes to sleep on the couch. Every morning I give them food and water. Sometimes I brush the cat and walk the dog. I love my pets very much because they are my friends and are always with me.

croatian: U Hrvatskoj ljudi slave Novu godinu s obitelji i prijateljima. U gradovima su koncerti na trgovima, a mnogi ljudi plešu i pjevaju. U ponoć svi gledaju vatromet i nazdravljaju čašom pića. Djeca se vesele svjetlima i glazbi. Neki ljudi idu u crkvu, a drugi ostaju kod kuće i gledaju televiziju. Hrana je važna: često se jedu kolači, meso i salate. Ujutro prvog siječnja svi žele jedni drugima sretnu i uspješnu novu godinu.
english: In Croatia people celebrate New Year with family and friends. In the cities there are concerts in the squares, and many people dance and sing. At midnight everyone watches fireworks and toasts with a glass of drink. Children enjoy the lights and music. Some people go to church, and others stay at home and watch television. Food is important: cakes, meat, and salads are often eaten. On the morning of the first of January everyone wishes each other a happy and successful new year.

croatian: Noćne životinje su životinje koje su aktivne noću. One danju spavaju, a noću traže hranu. Sove vide dobro u mraku i love miševe. Šišmiši lete noću i hvataju kukce. Ježevi noću traže hranu u vrtovima i šumama. Neke mačke također vole loviti po noći. Noćne životinje koriste miris i sluh da se snađu u tami.
english: Nocturnal animals are animals that are active at night. They sleep during the day and look for food at night. Owls see well in the dark and hunt mice. Bats fly at night and catch insects. Hedgehogs look for food at night in gardens and forests. Some cats also like to hunt at night. Nocturnal animals use smell and hearing to find their way in the dark.

croatian:
Lea je šetala rivom dok je sunce grijalo kamen i more mirno šuškalo uz obalu. Vidjela je mali kiosk s natpisom Sladoled – domaći okusi i odmah joj se razveselilo lice. Prišla je pultu, gdje je iza stajao nasmijani prodavač s bijelom kapom.
„Dobar dan,“ rekla je veselo. „Koje okuse imate?“
„Imamo čokoladu, vaniliju, jagodu, limun i pistaciju,“ odgovorio je prodavač.
Lea je razmišljala trenutak. „Molim jedan kornet s jagodom i čokoladom.“
„Naravno,“ rekao je prodavač i brzo napunio kornet. „Hoćete šlag?“
„Da, malo, molim,“ rekla je Lea i izvadila novčanik.
„To je tri eura,“ rekao je on s osmijehom.
Lea mu je pružila novac i uzela sladoled. Prvi zalogaj bio je hladan i sladak, savršen za vrući dan.
„Jako je dobar,“ rekla je zadovoljno.
„Drago mi je,“ odgovorio je prodavač. „Uživajte!“
Lea se nasmiješila i nastavila šetati rivom, lizajući sladoled i osjećajući se bezbrižno kao dijete.
english:
Lea was walking along the seaside promenade as the sun warmed the stone and the sea whispered softly against the shore. She saw a small stand with a sign that read Ice Cream – Homemade Flavors, and her face lit up. She walked to the counter, where a smiling vendor in a white cap stood.
“Good afternoon,” she said cheerfully. “What flavors do you have?”
“We have chocolate, vanilla, strawberry, lemon, and pistachio,” replied the vendor.
Lea thought for a moment. “One cone with strawberry and chocolate, please.”
“Of course,” said the vendor, quickly filling the cone. “Would you like whipped cream?”
“Yes, a little, please,” said Lea, taking out her wallet.
“That’s three euros,” he said with a smile.
Lea handed him the money and took her ice cream. The first bite was cold and sweet — perfect for a hot day.
“It’s really good,” she said happily.
“I’m glad,” said the vendor. “Enjoy!”
Lea smiled and continued walking along the promenade, licking her ice cream and feeling carefree like a child.

croatian: Kada sam prvi put živio u inozemstvu, najveći problem za mene bila je jezična barijera. Znao sam nekoliko osnovnih riječi, ali nisam mogao izraziti ono što stvarno mislim ili osjećam. Na početku sam se često osjećao izgubljeno i isključeno iz razgovora. Međutim, s vremenom sam shvatio da je jedini način da prevladam tu prepreku – riskirati i govoriti, čak i kada nisam siguran u točnost. Počeo sam postavljati jednostavna pitanja, tražiti objašnjenja i koristiti geste. Ljudi su uglavnom bili strpljivi i spremni pomoći, a ja sam polako stjecao samopouzdanje. Posebno mi je pomoglo kada sam pronašao prijatelje koji nisu kritizirali moje pogreške, nego su me poticali da nastavim pokušavati. Nakon nekoliko mjeseci primijetio sam da razgovaram prirodnije i da više ne razmišljam o svakoj riječi. Shvatio sam da je jezična barijera stvarna samo dok je sami gradimo. Kada prihvatimo nesavršenost i damo si vremena, komunikacija postaje moguća i odnosi se mogu graditi bez obzira na savršenstvo jezika.
english: When I first lived abroad, the biggest problem for me was the language barrier. I knew a few basic words, but I couldn’t express what I really thought or felt. At the beginning I often felt lost and excluded from conversations. However, over time I realized that the only way to overcome this obstacle was to take the risk and speak, even when I wasn’t sure about accuracy. I started asking simple questions, requesting explanations, and using gestures. People were generally patient and willing to help, and I slowly gained confidence. It especially helped when I found friends who didn’t criticize my mistakes but encouraged me to keep trying. After a few months I noticed that I was speaking more naturally and no longer thinking about every word. I realized that the language barrier exists only as long as we build it ourselves. When we accept imperfection and give ourselves time, communication becomes possible and relationships can be built regardless of perfect language.

croatian: Sutra idem na odmor i danas pakiram svoju torbu. Najprije stavljam majice i hlače. Zatim stavljam čarape i cipele. Ne zaboravljam četkicu za zube i sapun. Uzimam i knjigu jer volim čitati na plaži. Stavljam bocu vode i sunčane naočale u torbu. Provjeravam putovnicu i karte. Sada je torba puna i spremna. Veselim se svom odmoru!
english: Tomorrow I am going on vacation and today I am packing my bag. First I put in shirts and pants. Then I put in socks and shoes. I don’t forget my toothbrush and soap. I take a book because I like to read on the beach. I put a bottle of water and sunglasses in the bag. I check my passport and tickets. Now the bag is full and ready. I am looking forward to my vacation!

croatian: Jučer sam čekao vlak na željezničkom kolodvoru i imao sam mnogo vremena. Sjeo sam na klupu i počeo promatrati ljude oko sebe. Bilo je zanimljivo vidjeti koliko su svi različiti. Jedna obitelj je imala puno kofera i djeca su bila vrlo glasna. Mladi par je sjedio blizu i razgovarao tiho. Vidio sam i starijeg gospodina koji je čitao novine i mirno pio kavu. Neki ljudi su trčali jer nisu htjeli zakasniti na vlak, a drugi su stajali i gledali na sat. Promatranje ljudi mi je bilo zabavno jer svaka osoba ima svoju priču, a kolodvor je mjesto gdje se te priče na kratko sretnu.
english: Yesterday I waited for a train at the station and had a lot of time. I sat on a bench and started watching the people around me. It was interesting to see how different everyone was. One family had many suitcases and the children were very loud. A young couple sat nearby and spoke quietly. I also saw an older man who was reading a newspaper and calmly drinking coffee. Some people were running because they didn’t want to miss the train, and others stood still and looked at the clock. Watching people was fun because each person has their own story, and the station is a place where those stories meet for a short moment.

croatian: U svijetu postoje različiti politički sustavi. Neke države imaju demokraciju. U demokraciji ljudi glasaju i biraju vladu. Druge države imaju kralja ili kraljicu. To se zove monarhija. Neke države imaju predsjednika, a neke premijera. U nekim državama ljudi nemaju izbor. Politički sustavi su različiti, ali cilj je upravljati državom.
english: In the world there are different political systems. Some countries have democracy. In a democracy people vote and choose the government. Other countries have a king or a queen. This is called a monarchy. Some countries have a president, and some have a prime minister. In some countries people have no choice. Political systems are different, but the goal is to govern the country.

croatian: Sljedeći tjedan imam važan ispit i zato svaki dan učim. Ujutro pijem kavu i čitam bilješke iz škole. Zatim rješavam stare zadatke i ponavljam teške riječi. Ponekad idem u knjižnicu jer tamo mogu mirno raditi bez buke. Kada se umorim, napravim kratku pauzu i prošetam vani. Moj plan je učiti tri sata ujutro i dva sata navečer. Najviše se bojim gramatike, pa je ponavljam svaki dan. Znam da je priprema duga i ponekad dosadna, ali vjerujem da ću uspjeti ako radim redovito.
english: Next week I have an important exam, so I study every day. In the morning I drink coffee and read notes from school. Then I solve old exercises and repeat difficult words. Sometimes I go to the library because there I can work quietly without noise. When I get tired, I take a short break and walk outside. My plan is to study three hours in the morning and two hours in the evening. I am most afraid of grammar, so I repeat it every day. I know that preparation is long and sometimes boring, but I believe I will succeed if I work regularly.

croatian: Rim je glavni grad Italije i jedan od najstarijih gradova u Europi. Ima dugu i bogatu povijest. U Rimu se mogu vidjeti mnoge stare građevine. Poznata mjesta u Rimu su Kolosej, Forum i Fontana di Trevi. Grad je pun muzeja, crkava i trgova. Ljudi tamo vole šetati i piti kavu. Rim je također poznat po dobroj hrani. Tjestenina, pizza i gelato su vrlo popularni. Rim spaja povijest, kulturu i svakodnevni život.
english: Rome is the capital of Italy and one of the oldest cities in Europe. It has a long and rich history. There are many old buildings to see in Rome. Famous places in Rome are the Colosseum, the Forum and the Trevi Fountain. The city is full of museums, churches and squares. People there like to walk and drink coffee. Rome is also known for its good food. Pasta, pizza and gelato are very popular. Rome combines history, culture and everyday life.

croatian: Samovozeći automobili su vozila koja mogu voziti bez vozača. Oni koriste kamere, senzore i računala da vide cestu. Tako mogu prepoznati druga vozila, ljude i prometne znakove. Ovi automobili mogu sami kočiti, ubrzavati i skretati. Cilj je da vožnja bude sigurnija i lakša. Ljudi mogu sjediti i opustiti se dok auto vozi. Samovozeći automobili se još uvijek testiraju. U budućnosti bi mogli promijeniti način na koji putujemo i smanjiti broj nesreća.
english: Self-driving cars are vehicles that can drive without a driver. They use cameras, sensors and computers to see the road. This way they can recognize other vehicles, people and traffic signs. These cars can brake, accelerate and turn on their own. The aim is to make driving safer and easier. People can sit back and relax while the car drives. Self-driving cars are still being tested. In the future, they could change the way we travel and reduce the number of accidents.

croatian: Seul je glavni grad Južne Koreje. To je vrlo velik i moderan grad s mnogo ljudi. U Seulu se mogu vidjeti visoke zgrade i stari hramovi. Grad ima dobar javni prijevoz. Ljudi često koriste metro i autobuse. U Seulu ima puno restorana, trgovina i parkova. Seul je poznat po tehnologiji, glazbi i hrani. Tradicija i moderna kultura tamo žive zajedno.
english: Seoul is the capital of South Korea. It is a very large and modern city with many people. In Seoul, you can see tall buildings and old temples. The city has good public transport. People often use the subway and buses. There are many restaurants, shops and parks in Seoul. Seoul is famous for its technology, music and food. Tradition and modern culture live together there.

croatian:
Tom je hodao starom gradskom ulicom punom mirisa i boja. Iz svakog dućana dolazili su mirisi meda, lavande i svježe pečenih kolača. Zaustavio se pred malom trgovinom s natpisom Domaći proizvodi. Unutra je bilo tiho i mirisalo je na smokve i maslinovo ulje. Iza pulta je stajala ljubazna prodavačica.

„Dobar dan,“ rekao je Tom s osmijehom. „Tražim poklone za prijatelje. Možda nešto što se može jesti.“
Prodavačica je pokazala na policu punu staklenki. „Imamo domaći med, marmeladu od naranče i smokava, te maslinovo ulje iz Dalmacije.“
Tom je pažljivo pogledao proizvode. „Ovaj med izgleda lijepo. Koliko košta?“
„Sedam eura,“ odgovorila je ona. „A marmelada je pet.“
Tom je uzeo jednu staklenku meda i jednu marmeladu. „Uzeti ću ovo. Mogu platiti karticom?“
„Naravno,“ rekla je prodavačica i spakirala poklone u malu papirnatu vrećicu. „Želite li da stavim i naljepnicu s hrvatskom zastavom?“
„Da, to bi bilo odlično,“ rekao je Tom. „Prijatelji će se obradovati.“
„Sigurna sam da hoće,“ rekla je ona uz osmijeh. „Hvala i sretan put!“
Tom je zahvalio i izašao iz trgovine, noseći vrećicu koja je mirisala na med i more.
english:
Tom walked down an old city street full of scents and colors. From every shop came the smell of honey, lavender, and freshly baked pastries. He stopped in front of a small store with a sign that read Local Products. Inside, it was quiet and smelled of figs and olive oil. Behind the counter stood a friendly shopkeeper.

“Good afternoon,” Tom said with a smile. “I’m looking for gifts for friends — maybe something to eat.”
The shopkeeper pointed to a shelf full of jars. “We have homemade honey, orange and fig marmalade, and olive oil from Dalmatia.”
Tom looked at the products carefully. “This honey looks nice. How much is it?”
“Seven euros,” she replied. “And the marmalade is five.”
Tom picked up one jar of honey and one of marmalade. “I’ll take these. Can I pay by card?”
“Of course,” said the shopkeeper, packing the gifts into a small paper bag. “Would you like me to add a sticker with the Croatian flag?”
“Yes, that would be great,” said Tom. “My friends will be happy.”
“I’m sure they will,” she said with a smile. “Thank you, and have a good trip!”
Tom thanked her and left the shop, carrying a bag that smelled of honey and the sea.

croatian: Danas idem u trgovinu kupiti namirnice. Uzimam košaru i hodam kroz trgovinu. Kupujem kruh, mlijeko i sir. Uzimam i jabuke, banane i naranče. Trebam i rižu i tjesteninu. Na kraju idem na blagajnu i plaćam sve. Stavljam stvari u vrećicu i vraćam se kući. Sretan sam jer imam sve što trebam za ručak i večeru.
english: Today I am going to the store to buy groceries. I take a basket and walk through the store. I buy bread, milk, and cheese. I also take apples, bananas, and oranges. I need rice and pasta too. At the end I go to the checkout and pay for everything. I put the things in a bag and return home. I am happy because I have everything I need for lunch and dinner.

croatian: Za dobar san važno je ići u krevet svaku večer u isto vrijeme. Soba treba biti tiha i tamna. Nije dobro piti kavu ili energetska pića prije spavanja. Prije sna je bolje čitati knjigu ili slušati mirnu glazbu nego gledati televiziju. Ako spavamo osam sati svake noći, osjećamo se odmorno i imamo više energije tijekom dana.
english: For good sleep it is important to go to bed every evening at the same time. The room should be quiet and dark. It is not good to drink coffee or energy drinks before sleeping. Before sleep it is better to read a book or listen to calm music than to watch television. If we sleep eight hours every night, we feel rested and have more energy during the day.

croatian: Pametne kuće su domovi s modernom tehnologijom. U njima se koriste uređaji koji rade preko interneta. Ljudi ih mogu kontrolirati pomoću mobitela ili tableta. U pametnoj kući možemo uključiti svjetlo, grijanje ili televizor na daljinu. Neki sustavi mogu sami učiti naše navike. Tako kuća postaje ugodnija i štedi energiju. Pametne kuće pomažu ljudima da lakše žive. One su praktične, sigurne i sve popularnije u današnje vrijeme.
english: Smart homes are homes with modern technology. They use devices that work via the Internet. People can control them using their mobile phones or tablets. In a smart home, we can turn on the lights, heating or TV remotely. Some systems can learn our habits on their own. This makes the house more comfortable and saves energy. Smart homes help people live easier. They are practical, safe and increasingly popular today.

croatian: Djevojčica Chihiro putuje s roditeljima. Oni stanu kod tunela i uđu u prazan grad. Roditelji jedu hranu i pretvore se u svinje. Chihiro se boji i bježi. Upoznaje dječaka Hakua koji joj pomaže. Ona radi u kupalištu za duhove. Upoznaje čudna bića i staru čarobnicu Yubabu. Chihiro mora biti hrabra da spasi roditelje. Na kraju, Haku joj pomogne pronaći pravi put. Chihiro odlazi iz svijeta duhova i opet vidi svoje roditelje.
english: A young girl named Chihiro travels with her parents. They stop at a tunnel and enter an empty city. Her parents eat the food and turn into pigs. Chihiro is scared and runs away. She meets a boy named Haku who helps her. She works at a ghost bathhouse. She meets strange creatures and the old sorceress Yubaba. Chihiro must be brave to save her parents. In the end, Haku helps her find the right path. Chihiro leaves the ghost world and sees her parents again.

croatian: Split je drugi najveći grad u Hrvatskoj. Nalazi se na obali Jadranskog mora. U središtu Splita nalazi se Dioklecijanova palača, stara više od tisuću sedamsto godina. U palači danas žive ljudi, rade trgovine i kafići. Ljeti u Split dolazi mnogo turista. Oni šetaju rivom, piju kavu i gledaju more. U blizini su lijepe plaže, a more je toplo i čisto. Split je poznat i po nogometu — mnogi navijaju za klub Hajduk. Navečer grad živi uz glazbu i svjetla, a more miriše po soli i ljetu.
english: Split is the second largest city in Croatia. It is located on the Adriatic coast. In the center of Split is the Diocletian's Palace, which is more than 1,700 years old. Today, people live in the palace, and there are shops and cafes. Many tourists come to Split in the summer. They walk along the waterfront, drink coffee and look at the sea. There are beautiful beaches nearby, and the sea is warm and clean. Split is also famous for football - many support the Hajduk club. In the evenings, the city comes alive with music and lights, and the sea smells of salt and summer.

croatian: Kada smo u kući, možemo ostati aktivni na jednostavne načine. Možemo raditi lagane vježbe, kao što su istezanje, čučnjevi ili sklekovi. Ples uz glazbu je također dobra vježba i zabava. Neki ljudi koriste sobni bicikl ili traku za trčanje. Čišćenje kuće, usisavanje i pranje podova također pomažu tijelu da se kreće. Važno je svaki dan malo vježbati, iako smo u kući.
english: When we are at home, we can stay active in simple ways. We can do light exercises, such as stretching, squats, or push-ups. Dancing to music is also good exercise and fun. Some people use an exercise bike or treadmill. Cleaning the house, vacuuming, and washing floors also help the body move. It is important to exercise a little every day, even if we are at home.

croatian: Ulična hrana je hrana koja se prodaje na ulici. Može se kupiti na štandovima, tržnicama ili malim kolicima. U mnogim gradovima je vrlo popularna. Ljudi jedu uličnu hranu jer je brza i često jeftina. Može biti slana ili slatka. Svaka zemlja ima svoje posebne vrste ulične hrane. Ulična hrana pokazuje lokalnu kulturu i okuse. Mnogi turisti je vole jer mogu probati nešto novo i drugačije.
english: Street food is food sold on the street. It can be bought from stalls, markets, or small carts. It is very popular in many cities. People eat street food because it is fast and often cheap. It can be savory or sweet. Each country has its own special types of street food. Street food shows off the local culture and flavors. Many tourists like it because they can try something new and different.

croatian: Sushi je japansko jelo. On se pravi od riže, ribe i povrća. Ponekad sushi ima i jaje ili alge. Sushi može biti sirov ili kuhan. U Japanu ljudi često jedu sushi, ali i u drugim državama je popularan. Sushi se jede štapićima ili rukom. Mnogi ljudi vole sushi jer je ukusan i zdrav.
english: Sushi is a Japanese dish. It is made from rice, fish, and vegetables. Sometimes sushi has egg or seaweed. Sushi can be raw or cooked. In Japan people often eat sushi, but it is also popular in other countries. Sushi is eaten with chopsticks or with the hand. Many people like sushi because it is tasty and healthy.

croatian:
Nina je stigla na aerodrom rano ujutro s malim ruksakom i koferom na kotačiće. Bila je uzbuđena zbog putovanja, ali malo nervozna zbog sigurnosne kontrole. Red je bio dug, a ljudi su polako vadili svoje stvari iz torbi. Kad je došla na red, službenik joj se obratio ljubazno, ali ozbiljno.

„Dobar dan,“ rekao je. „Molim vas, stavite sve metalne predmete u posudu.“
Nina je kimnula i skinula sat, remen i jaknu. „Treba li i laptop van?“ pitala je nesigurno.
„Da, molim,“ odgovorio je službenik. „I tekućine stavite u prozirnu vrećicu.“
Nina je otvorila torbu i pokazala malu bocu vode. „Smijem li to zadržati?“
Službenik se nasmiješio. „Nažalost, ne. Vodu možete popiti prije nego što prođete kontrolu.“
Nina je popila nekoliko gutljaja i bacila bocu u kantu. Kad je prošla kroz detektor, uređaj je zazvonio.
„Molim vas, stanite na stranu,“ rekao je službenik. „Samo mala provjera.“
Nina se nasmijala nervozno. „Nemam ništa metalno, stvarno.“
„U redu je,“ rekao je on i lagano je pregledao. „Sad je sve u redu. Ugodan let!“
Nina je duboko uzdahnula od olakšanja, uzela svoje stvari i krenula prema izlazu. Putovanje je moglo početi.
english:
Nina arrived at the airport early in the morning with a small backpack and a rolling suitcase. She was excited about her trip but a little nervous about the security check. The line was long, and people were slowly taking things out of their bags. When it was her turn, the officer spoke kindly but firmly.

“Good morning,” he said. “Please put all metal items in the tray.”
Nina nodded and removed her watch, belt, and jacket. “Do I need to take out the laptop too?” she asked uncertainly.
“Yes, please,” the officer replied. “And put any liquids in a clear bag.”
Nina opened her bag and showed a small bottle of water. “Can I keep this?”
The officer smiled. “I’m afraid not. You can drink it before you pass through security.”
Nina took a few sips and threw the bottle away. When she walked through the detector, it beeped.
“Please step to the side,” the officer said. “Just a quick check.”
Nina laughed nervously. “I don’t have anything metal, really.”
“That’s fine,” he said and quickly checked. “All good now. Have a nice flight!”
Nina sighed with relief, gathered her things, and headed toward the gate. Her journey could finally begin.

croatian:
Jutro je bilo svježe i mirisalo je na kruh. Ivan je hodao prema maloj pekarnici na uglu ulice. Ispred vrata stajala je starija gospođa s vrećicom punom peciva, a iznutra se čuo zvuk blagajne i miris svježe kave. Ivan je ušao i pozdravio veselu prodavačicu iza pulta.

„Dobar dan,“ rekao je. „Imate li još tople kifle?“
„Imamo,“ odgovorila je prodavačica i pokazala na policu iza sebe. „Upravo su izašle iz pećnice.“
Ivan se nasmiješio. „Odlično! Molim dvije kifle i jedan kolač s čokoladom.“
Prodavačica je pažljivo stavila peciva u papirnatu vrećicu. „Još nešto?“ pitala je.
„Možda jedan mali kruh,“ rekao je Ivan nakon kratkog razmišljanja.
„Naravno,“ rekla je i dodala kruh u vrećicu. „To će biti četiri eura.“
Ivan joj je pružio novčanicu i primio vrećicu koja je još mirisala na pećnicu. „Hvala vam i ugodan dan.“
„I vama, doviđenja!“ rekla je prodavačica s osmijehom.
Ivan je izašao van, a topli miris svježeg kruha pratio ga je niz ulicu.
english:
The morning was fresh and smelled of bread. Ivan walked toward a small bakery on the corner of the street. In front of the door stood an elderly lady with a bag full of pastries, and inside came the sound of the cash register and the aroma of fresh coffee. Ivan entered and greeted the cheerful woman behind the counter.

“Good morning,” he said. “Do you still have warm rolls?”
“We do,” the woman replied, pointing to the shelf behind her. “They just came out of the oven.”
Ivan smiled. “Perfect! Two rolls and one chocolate pastry, please.”
The woman carefully placed the pastries into a paper bag. “Anything else?” she asked.
“Maybe one small loaf of bread,” Ivan said after a short thought.
“Of course,” she said, adding the bread to the bag. “That will be four euros.”
Ivan handed her a bill and took the bag, still warm from the oven. “Thank you, and have a nice day.”
“You too, goodbye!” the woman said with a smile.
Ivan walked outside, the warm scent of fresh bread following him down the street.

croatian:
